t:
In the quiet of the night, I fret and contemplate,
The poem lay unwritten, its author running late.
The prompt sat on the app, patiently it did wait,
Yet the words refused to flow, they seemed to hesitate.

The clock ticked on relentless, marking the passing date,
I wrestled with words, locked in a silent debate.
The pressure of the writing sprint, a looming daunting fate,
Yet rushing through the lines was a choice I'd hate.
c:
The words should've flowed, but I dawdle, I procrastinate,
Rhymes danced in my mind in a chaotic state.
Finding words that would match, oh it was no easy fate,
But I persevered through the struggle, I pushed through the strait.

And so here it is completed, though it might be somewhat late,
Although in this creative endeavor, I couldn't accelerate.
And though I'm belated, my words I dedicate,
To express the truth of why this poem is late.



If you are good with words, you might like this: https://sherlockdoyle.github.io/antonemo/ (link also available in profile)
